skill.name: bazel-build-optimization
skill.description: Optimize Bazel builds for large-scale monorepos. Use when configuring Bazel, implementing remote execution, or optimizing build performance for enterprise codebases.

skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with instructional templates for Bazel optimization. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variable reading. Contains only markdown documentation and example Bazel configuration patterns.

content.user_title: Optimize Bazel builds for large monorepos
content.value_statement: Large Bazel builds can become slow and hard to maintain. This skill provides proven templates and workflows to improve speed and reliability.
actual_capabilities: Offer TypeScript and Python BUILD file examples
Show a custom Bazel rule pattern for Docker images
List Bazel query commands for dependency analysis
Outline remote execution platform and toolchain setup
limitations: Does not run Bazel commands or modify your repository
Requires project-specific versions and URLs to be filled in
Does not validate remote cache or executor availability
Does not generate full CI configuration files

use_cases.title: Standardize monorepo builds
use_cases.description: Adopt consistent Bazel configs and templates across teams for faster builds.

use_cases.title: Design remote execution setup
use_cases.description: Draft platform and toolchain definitions for a remote execution cluster.

use_cases.title: Reduce build times
use_cases.description: Identify caching and profiling steps to cut slow Bazel pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Start Bazel setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a minimal WORKSPACE.bazel and .bazelrc for a TypeScript and Python monorepo. Include placeholders for URLs and versions.

prompt_templates.title: Improve caching
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend .bazelrc settings for local disk cache and remote cache. Explain when to enable remote upload.

prompt_templates.title: Add build rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft BUILD.bazel examples for a TypeScript library and a Python library with tests.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize performance
prompt_templates.prompt: List Bazel query and profiling commands to identify slow targets and high fanout dependencies.

output_examples.input: Help me speed up Bazel builds in a large monorepo
output: Enable disk and repository caching in .bazelrc to reuse artifacts
Add remote cache flags and set upload to share results in CI
Use bazel analyze-profile to find slow actions and large targets

best_practices: Use fine grained targets to maximize cache hits
Pin Bazel rules and tool versions for reproducible builds
Profile builds regularly and address slow actions early
anti_patterns: Relying on broad globs for dependencies
Skipping WORKSPACE setup or rule pinning
Ignoring build warnings and analysis cache issues

faq.question: Is this compatible with any Bazel version?
faq.answer: It is version agnostic but you must set the correct Bazel and rules versions for your repo.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates but does not execute or validate builds.

faq.question: Can it integrate with remote execution services?
faq.answer: It outlines platform and toolchain setup, but service credentials and endpoints are required.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. The content is static guidance and does not access files or environment variables.

faq.question: What if my build is still slow?
faq.answer: Use profiling commands to find slow actions and review target granularity and caching.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic Bazel docs?
faq.answer: It focuses on enterprise monorepo patterns and practical templates for performance.
